revised_title: Self-Duality in Four-Dimensional Riemannian Geometry: Applications and Moduli Spaces
tldr: This article presents a self-contained account of the ideas connecting four-dimensional Riemannian geometry with three-dimensional complex analysis, focusing on self-dual metrics and their applications. The authors apply these concepts to the self-dual Yang-Mills equations in Euclidean 4-space and compute the number of moduli for any compact gauge group. They also discuss the relation between self-duality and holomorphic structures, and explore the moduli space of self-dual connections and their applications to various Lie groups.
